definition: coming and going alone (idiom); a lone operator/keeping to oneself/unsociable/maverick
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

sentences.english: When you are a loner, you frighten people.
sentences.chinese: 可是当你独来独往，那他们就会怕你了。

sentences.english: God has not meant for anyone to go through life alone.
sentences.chinese: 上帝没有意愿让任何人在生活中独来独往。

sentences.english: Dogs, by nature, are not loners.
sentences.chinese: 狗，天性就不喜独来独往。

sentences.english: Police said Auvinen is from Tuusula and who acted alone.
sentences.chinese: 警方说奥维宁来自图苏拉，平日独来独往。

sentences.english: You're always alone unless forced to be with other people and you love to cause trouble.
sentences.chinese: 除非逼不得已，你总是独来独往，而你喜欢制造麻烦。

sentences.english: Like the hyena, it hunts for food at night, almost always alone.
sentences.chinese: 它像鬣狗一样，夜晚捕食，几乎总是独来独往。

definition: to fit in/to get on well with others/sociable/to form a mutually supportive group
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
to live together (in a large group or flock)
